newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Min Xin up on Xiamen bank listing report.
newsitem.headline: Min Xin up on Xiamen bank listing report.

text.p: Shares of China-backed investment and financial concern Min Xin Holdings Ltd rose on Thursday on talk of its 36.7 percent owned Xiamen International Bank seeking a listing in Hong Kong, brokers said.
The shares rose HK$0.25 or 20.66 percent to hit an intraday high of HK$1.46 in the early afternoon, on volume of 1.12 million shares worth HK$1.53 million.

"The talks fuelled hope of stronger earnings because of a possible exceptional gain from the listing," a sales manager at a local brokerage said. "Improved sentiment for China concept stocks also helped."
Brokers said sentiment for China concept stocks improved on anticipation of a Chinese interest rate cut over the weekend. Future earnings were seen likely to benefit from the rate cut.
A local press had reported that Min Xin's Xiamen International Bank was considering a flotation in Hong Kong.
